cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles south of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward parallel to the U.S. East Coast, brushing North Carolina tonight, then moving offshore toward the Canadian Maritimes
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: North Carolina Outer Banks/Cape Hatteras area

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in Florida; hurricane/TS watches now confined to Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings from South Santee River SC to NC/VA border; Tropical-Storm warnings north to Fenwick Island DE and parts of coastal New England; Storm-Surge warnings Cape Fear NC to Poquoson VA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coast from South Carolina northward through North Carolina, then Mid-Atlantic and eventually New England and Atlantic Canada
weather_observation.wind: Only brief tropical-storm-force gusts (if any) are expected; overall winds remaining below gale force at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at Port of Palm Beach; surge threat confined to the Carolinas and northward.
weather_observation.rainfall: No significant heavy rainfall anticipated at the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Hazardous seas and rip currents will persist along the southeast Florida coast despite the stormâ€™s departure.
